channel.title: Practice Happiness
channel.description: Mahasukha provides practical instruction for a vibrant, meaningful life infused with ethical integrity, compassion for others, mindful awareness and wisdom. The Center offers classes, grounded in the time-tested doctrines and practices found in the ancient Tibetan and Indian Sanskrit texts, for realizing deep peace within our modern lifestyle. Everyone is welcome to enjoy weekly yoga classes, guided meditations, in-depth study courses, community events and seasonal retreats. A wide variety of audio and video teachings are available in our Media library. All classes and events, unless otherwise noted, are offered by donation only.

item.title: PH82 - What is happiness really? - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
The true nature of happiness and the simple tools of how to attain it now are explained by Mahasukha teacher Lauren Benjamin.

The Mahasukha Center (in Sanskrit "great bliss") provides a wide range of courses including guided meditations, Buddha dharma, teachings on spiritual partners, workshops by nationally known yoga teachers, and informal talks on a variety of subjects.

The Mahasukha Center

Los Angeles, CA 90045
Phone: (323) 617-3691

item.title: PH81 - Developing a Happiness Habit - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Mahasukha teacher Lauren Benjamin leads a contemplation on getting in touch with your inner-most happiness, inner wisdom and compassion and habituating your mind to cultivate these enlightened qualities in your daily life.

item.title: PH80 - How to stop being upset - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
Mahasuka teacher Cliff Spenser guides us through logic and reasoning for cultivating patience from Master Shantideva’s The Guide to the Bodhisattva’s Way. He discusses why anger and happiness cannot co-exist and explains how to see that patience and joy is the only reasonable reaction to when you feel anger.

Podcast taken from Guide to the Bodhisattva’s Way of Life, Part 2

item.title: PH43 Making Others Happy to Make Ourselves Happy (pt.2) - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:

item.title: PH41 Meditation, Refuge and the Three Jewels - Mira Kingsley
item.description:
The Six Preliminaries and Seven Ingredients of a daily meditation practice including an explanation of how to go for Refuge in "the Three Jewels", as taught by Asian Classics Institute teacher Mira Kingsley.

Podcast taken from: Lama Mira Kingsley, Dharma Essential 3: Applied Meditation, Class 1
You can listen to the full teaching at: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_kingsley.html

item.title: PH40 A Living Lineage - Rick Blue
item.description: How the Tibetan Buddhist lineage has been faithfully transplanted into the west as taught by senior teacher Rick Blue.

item.title: PH39 Be on a mission, not a chore - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
How to make your meditation, your work and your life a sweet offering even when things are difficult. Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse delivers a beautiful introduction to the third of her 'Good Heart" teachings.

Mahasukha Center, LosAngeles, www.aci-la.org

You can listen to the whole teaching at: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_crouse.html

item.title: PH38 How to Sit and Breathe - Meditation Basics pt1 - Claire Thompson
item.description:
All the basic tips and hints you'll need to get you on the meditation cushion everyday, whether you're a beginner or an experienced practitioner revising. Taught by Asian Classics Institute teacher Claire Thompson.

Mahasukha Center, LosAngeles, www.aci-la.org

item.title: PH37 Buddha-plasty... using the 'Perfections' to create your body as that of a Buddha - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
How to use the first 3 of the '6 Perfections' to create the merit that leads to the body of a Buddha. From Master Shantideva's classic text "Guide to the Bodhisattva's way of life", as taught by Senior Asian Classics Teacher Cliff Spencer.

Mahasukha Center, LosAngeles, www.aci-la.org

item.title: PH36 How to Train Your Wild Mental Stallion - Mira Kingsley
item.description:
Learn how meditation is a Dharma Essential, especially if we treat it like a Thoroughbred, instead of a miniature pony. From the teachings of Asian Classics Institute teacher Mira Kingsley.

Podcast taken from: Lama Mira Kingsley, Dharma Essential 3: Applied Meditation, Class 1
You can listen to the full teaching at: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_kingsley.html

item.title: PH35 Demystifying Emptiness - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse gives a simple yet insightful explanation of the Buddhist principle of Emptiness. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

Podcast taken from: Lama Lindsay's 'Lojong' course, class 1
You can listen to the full teaching at: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_crouse.html

item.title: PH34 Why Aren't We in Control of Our Lives? - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
Why we can't get our reality to match our expectations as taught by Senior Asian Classics Teacher Cliff Spencer.

Mahasukha Center, LosAngeles, www.aci-la.org

From ACI Green Tara Retreat Teaching 2010: Class 01
http://www.aci-la.org/teach_spencer_retreat.html

item.title: PH33 A Zen Master, A Monk, and a Rabbi go to play golf - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Learn how deep meditation and the realizations of the path are founded in great compassion and true renunciation. As described by Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lauren Benjamin.

Podcast taken from: Lama Lauren Benjamin Bok Jinpa 1, class 2.
You can listen to the full teaching at: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_benjamin_bokjinpa.html

item.title: PH32 The 3 types of suffering and how to stop them - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Like a fish trying to imagine fire, we are so used to suffering we can barely comprehend a life without it. Senior teacher Lauren Benjamin explains our suffering and how we can stop it.

Podcast taken from Senior teacher Lauren Benjamin's 'BokJinpa' Course 1, class 2. You can listen to the full teaching at:
http://www.aci-la.org/teach_benjamin_bokjinpa.html

item.title: PH31 Exiting the Highway to Hell - Rick Blue
item.description: Why we must karmically rewrite the script of our lives by getting off of the highway to oblivion as taught by senior teacher Rick Blue.

item.title: PH30 What can we truly offer someone? - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
The three forms of offerings and why and how to give them as explained by Mahasukha's new Spiritual Advisor Cliff Spencer.

Mahasukha Center, LosAngeles, www.aci-la.org

Podcast taken from the ACI Course X: A Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life, Part 1, Level 3 of Middle Way Philosophy
Lama Cliff, Course 10, Class 3

item.title: Why should I meditate? - Lauren Benjamin
item.description: Why should I meditate? The benefits of meditation, from living a happier life all the way up to enlightenment itself, as explained by Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lauren Benjamin.

item.title: Spiritual Partners: Looking for love in all the wrong places - Lindsay Crouse and Rick Blue
item.description:
How the happiness we experience in relationships and life doesn't come from something outside of us, taught by Mahasukha senior teachers Lindsay Crouse and Rick Blue.

Podcast taken from Lamas Rick and Lindsay's course on Spiritual Partnership, 'Dharma of Love' Part 3, The Real Miracle Grow' class 1.

You can listen to the full teaching at http://www.aci-la.org/teach_blue.html

item.title: Spiritual Partners – Exchanging your self for the other - Lindsay Crouse and Rick Blue
item.description:
How putting forth effort to make someone we love happy results in our own happiness. Mahasukha senior teachers Lindsay Crouse and Rick Blue explain why.

Podcast taken from: Lamas Rick and Lindsay's 'Dharma of Love Part 3 -
The Real Miracle Grow' course on Spiritual Partnership, class 1.
You can listen to the full teaching at: http://www.aci-la.org/teach_blue.html

item.title: Rewriting the Script of Your Life - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse talks about karma using acting analogies. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

Podcast taken from: Lama Lindsay's "No More Enemies At All, New York City" - class 2A
You can listen to the full teaching at:
http://www.aci-la.org/teach_crouse_enemies.html

item.title: Relationships as an Enlightenment Machine - Rick Blue
item.description: Everyone we interact with can be our teacher. Mahasukha senior teacher Rick Blue reveals how.

item.title: Smash Self-Cherishing and Get Happy - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Radical ideas on how to stop the source of all our suffering - thinking about ‘me’ first - as taught by Senior teacher Lauren Benjamin as she explores Buddhist Master Dharmarakshita’s famous text.
Podcast taken from: Lama Lauren's Lojong Dharma essentials course, Class 4. You can listen to the full teaching at:
http://www.aci-la.org/teach_benjamin_DE.html

item.title: Spiritual Partners: growing and sustaining your love
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse teaches how to use our understanding of the workings of karma to have happy, lasting relationships.
Podcast taken from: Lamas Rick and Lindsay's 'Dharma of Love Part 3 - The Real Miracle Grow' course on Spiritual Partnership. You can listen to the full teaching at:
http://www.aci-la.org/teach_blue.html

item.title: There Are No Fixed Things, Only Process and Potential - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Why understanding the Buddhist concept of impermanence can lead you toward wisdom and bliss as taught by Senior ACI teacher Lama Lauren Benjamin.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Three Beings Walk Into A Bar - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
Why three beings can experience the same thing in three different ways and how this understanding relates to the power of changing our lives by changing our karma Mahasukha senior teacher Cliff Spencer.

Mahasukha Center, LosAngeles, www.aci-la.org

item.title: Will Whoever's Talking Please Stand Up, Even If That Person is Me? - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse gives a lovely, lyrically concise version of flow, change, interdependence and how we write our own stories.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: The Top 10 Actions to Stop Suffering - Rick Blue
item.description: Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Rick Blue reviews how to create a wonderful life through stopping 10 misdeeds.

item.title: Change Your World by Making Others Happy - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lauren Benjamin reveals the inescapable origins of our own happiness.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Cast yourself as an angel - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse talks about using your imagination to live a joyful life as a Bodhisattva."

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: The Movie of your Life - Rick Blue
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Rick Blue describes how karma works like a movie.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Develop a good heart daily with Lojong (pt 2) - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
ACI Senior Teacher Lauren Benjamin details how to destroy self-cherishing using Lojong from the brilliant text of Kadampa Geshe Chekhawa. (Part 2 of 2)

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Maybe Your Life Is A Fairytale And You Just Don’t Know It - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse (with an assist from The Brothers Grimm) addresses the fact that we do indeed create our own universe.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Can I Be Both Tender and Honest? - Lindsay Crouse
item.description:
Senior Asian Classics Institute teacher Lindsay Crouse lets us sit in on a conversation at her family dinner table where we soon see how others are a mirror of ourselves. Hamlet makes an appearance too.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Arming Yourself Against Anger - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
Senior A.C.I. Teacher Cliff Spencer teaches us how to eradicate anger from our lives using the classic Buddhist text “A guide to the Bodhisattva’s Way of Life”.
Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Develop a good heart daily with Lojong (pt 1) - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
ACI Senior Teacher Lauren Benjamin details how to destroy self-cherishing using Lojong from the brilliant text of Kadampa Geshe Chekhawa.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: When is it all right for a Buddhist to kill? - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
Senior Teacher Cliff Spencer describes how to imagine a life where you are never controlled by anger.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: True compassion and its mortal enemies - Lauren Benjamin
item.description:
Senior ACI teacher Lauren Benjamin speaks on developing true compassion and the forces that work against it.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Why karma is not like a boomerang - Cliff Spencer
item.description:
Senior ACI teacher Cliff Spencer reveals the hidden process of karma and it's different types.

Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Venerable Sumati Marut leads a roundtable discussion on the significance of Tibetan Buddhism in America with the ACI-LA senior teachers
item.description: Lama Marut speaks with the ACI-LA senior teachers about blending Tibetan Buddhism with Western lifestyle while retaining its legacy and the controversy of living a spiritual life. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Venerable Sumati Marut discusses a practical understanding of major Buddhist principles with ACI-LA senior teachers Rick Blue and Cliff Spencer
item.description: Karma, past and future lives, emptiness. Lama Marut speaks with ACI-LA senior teachers Rick Blue and Cliff Spencer about comprehending these Buddhist fundamentals in everyday terms. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Venerable Sumati Marut talks with the women leaders of ACI-LA
item.description: Lama Marut speaks with ACI-LA President Lauren Benjamin and senior teacher Lindsay Crouse about the changing, powerful role of women in Buddhism as it takes root in the West. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Venerable Sumati Marut talks with accomplished TV/film director and editor Rick Blue
item.description: Lama Marut speaks with director and editor Rick Blue of the hit TV series Scrubs about how he integrates spirituality into his career and the importance of being a student, especially as an ACI-LA senior teacher. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Venerable Sumati Marut talks with woodworking wunderkind and family man Cliff Spencer
item.description: Lama Marut speaks with furniture maker, father, husband and ACI-LA senior teacher Cliff Spencer about how finding his spiritual teacher transformed his self-destructive streak into a life built on happiness and compassion. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Lama Marut speaks with ACI-LA President and senior teacher Lauren Benjamin
item.description: Lama Marut speaks with ACI-LA President and senior teacher Lauren Benjamin about her secret to persevering on the spiritual path, defining the female role model of a teacher and discovering how meditation feeds happiness. Mahasukha Center, LA: www.aci-la.org

item.title: Venerable Sumati Marut talks with Academy Award-nominated actress Lindsay Crouse.
item.description: Lama Marut speaks with Academy Award-nominated actress and ACI-LA senior teacher Lindsay Crouse about her spiritual path as an actor and dedicated practitioner and teacher of Buddhism. Mahasukha Center: www.aci-la.org
